faqSection.title: Essential Information About Leasing Commercial Shops in Sector 86 Gurugram Answers
faqSection.description: Get clarity on common questions regarding lease agreements, maintenance charges, legal permissions, and the specific advantages of renting commercial property in Sector 86. We provide expert answers to help streamline your decision-making process and move into your new shop faster.

faqs.question: What is the typical lease duration for a shop for rent in Sector 86 Gurugram
faqs.answer: The standard commercial lease agreement in Sector 86 typically spans 36 months or three years. This is often structured with a lock-in period of 12 to 18 months, requiring both tenant and landlord commitment during this time. Long-term agreements up to 5 or 9 years may be negotiated depending on the size of the shop and the tenant's profile, usually involving periodic rental escalations as defined in the contract terms.

faqs.question: Are maintenance charges included in the quoted monthly rent for Sector 86 shops
faqs.answer: No, generally maintenance charges are billed separately from the base rent. These charges cover common area services like security, power backup for common facilities, cleaning, elevator operation, and upkeep of structural components. Tenants should budget an additional amount, usually calculated per square foot, for these monthly operating expenses which vary based on the commercial complex management.

faqs.question: What documentation is required to finalize a commercial lease agreement in this sector
faqs.answer: To finalize the lease for a shop in Sector 86, you will typically need the following documents for verification and legal processing identity proof of the proprietor/partners/directors address proof registration certificate of the business or firm PAN Card of the entity and financial statements or bank guarantees showing capability to meet rental obligations. A security deposit usually equivalent to 3 to 6 months rent is also required.

faqs.question: Can I make structural modifications to the shop interior once I rent the space
faqs.answer: Most commercial leases allow for interior modifications like false ceilings, flooring changes, and partitioning, provided they are non-structural and do not affect the building's integrity or common infrastructure. All proposed modifications must receive written consent from the landlord and/or the RWA/Building Management before commencement to ensure compliance with building bylaws.

faqs.question: Is parking readily available for customers and staff near the shops in Sector 86
faqs.answer: Yes, one of the key advantages of renting commercial space in the newer developments of Sector 86 is the provision of ample parking. Most complexes offer dedicated basement or multi-level parking specifically for tenants and customers, minimizing traffic congestion and improving overall client experience compared to older, congested markets in Gurugram.

faqs.question: What is the typical security deposit required for commercial rentals here
faqs.answer: The standard security deposit for shops for rent in Sector 86 is generally equivalent to three to six months of the agreed-upon rent. This deposit is refundable upon the successful completion of the lease term, provided the tenant has adhered to all terms and conditions and returned the property in good condition, minus standard wear and tear.

faqs.question: How soon can I occupy the commercial space after signing the lease agreement
faqs.answer: Occupancy time depends primarily on the current condition of the shop and the extent of fit-out work required. If the shop is already 'bare shell' and you require minor interior work, you might gain possession immediately upon lease registration. If extensive construction is needed, the lease may include a rent-free fit-out period, usually ranging from 30 to 60 days.

faqs.question: Are there specific business types restricted from renting space in Sector 86 commercial complexes
faqs.answer: While most retail and service businesses are welcome, specific uses such as heavy industrial manufacturing units, certain high-emission activities, or businesses involving significant environmental impact are generally prohibited or heavily restricted. Always confirm your specific business use is permitted under the local zoning and complex regulations prior to signing the lease.

faqs.question: How do rent escalations typically work in Sector 86 commercial leases
faqs.answer: Rental escalation is a standard clause in commercial leases. The most common structure is a fixed percentage increase, usually between 10 to 15 percent, implemented upon the renewal of the lease term, which typically happens every three years. Market-linked increases or CPI-based adjustments are less common but can be negotiated depending on the contract.

faqs.question: Why is Sector 86 considered a better investment than older Gurugram markets
faqs.answer: Sector 86 offers unparalleled advantages including high-quality infrastructure, high-rise residential density ensuring immediate customer base, ample parking, and better connectivity to the NCR. Unlike older markets dealing with infrastructure limitations, Sector 86 is future-proofed, offering superior visibility and operational efficiency for modern retail businesses.
